title: Plenary Session: The Role of the OER Community
segmentation: Hi everybody, my name is cable green.
I'm the director of Open Education at Creative Commons next slide.
Or I should say only slide.
So this is the one thing that I wanted to talk about.
You've heard me talk about this.
You've heard Ryan talk about this, but I believe as far as all the actions that we could consider.
This is one of the most important, and it's also within the realm of the possibility of what you, the governments can do.
And that is that you should.
And I'm going to use the word should implement open licensing requirements to ensure that all all of the public money that you spend.
On procuring or producing educational resources, be openly licensed, and I'm even more specific.
I suggest that you choose a CC by license, the Creative Commons Attribution license.
Here are the reasons why this 5 #1 government increases impact reach and scalability of its grants and contracts.
When it does this number 2 government creates conditions for maximum potential value created from the resources it funds.
More efficiency and better stewardship of public funds.
#3 the public has access to the educational resources that it funded that these are taxpayer dollars.
We're talking about the public should have access to what they pay for.
Number 4 innovative an entrepreneurial uses of openly licensed materials are enabled and #5.
These resources are available for reuse and for value.
Add by.
Anybody, not just the grantees, but anybody, including the citizens in your country, educators, scientists, public sector, employees, entrepreneurs, Ann, yes, commercial businesses.
If you implement this, you will get much more bang for your euro or whatever currency you work with.
This is a better and more effective use of public funds.
If this is something that you want to do, many of the IGO's and Creative Commons here.
Do this kind of work with you, so if you want help with this, Creative Commons will help.
UNESCO is good at this and the Commonwealth of Learning is active as well.
Thank you.
